Objective 1: Advocate for sustainable rainwater harvesting and management practices through policy formulation and sharing information Objective 2: Develop the Capacity in the Sector for sustainable harvesting and management of rainwater for domestic and production purposes

The National Development Plan (2010 - 2015) noted lack of knowledge and experience in adaptation of water harvesting techniques and proposed systematic implementation of domestic rainwater harvesting at household and community level. The Vision 2040 noted challenges in management of water resources and proposed construction of medium and large reservoirs to deal with water floods and water shortages

Uganda Rainwater Association (URWA) is a national membership non-governmental organization (NGO) that was formed in 1999. URWA supports communities to improve their socio-economic situation through mobilization, information, skills and experience sharing. The major focus of community support is promotion of rainwater harvesting for domestic water supply, agricultural production, and environment use

Uganda Rainwater Association is working towards increased awareness creation for stakeholders to recognize the role of rainwater harvesting in increasing access to clean water for improving hygiene in homes, schools, health centres and other public institutions, and also its role in improving livelihoods by providing water for production and environment conservation
